reviews.text: Very nice decor and the Pizza was good. I was expecting more from what others told me. Its a slice that you have to eat while hot. They use a thin crust without asking. Its fancy pizza and pricy. Cheese Pizza starts at $20. One size. Im sure they'll do well.

UPDATE 6/9/2024
I am changing my review to 5 stars. I've ordered 4x in the last 6 weeks and each time the food has been great. The staff has been super friendly(they always were), but the food has been delicious.  I got their Monday special for a large classic pie for $10 and it tastes way better than my encounter (found below) from last January. Glad to see their leadership has taken control and changed the quality of food. Will definitely be coming back , also really happy because they are conveniently located for me. Love to support local business.

UPDATE 1/9/23
Ordered a large pie and there was a piece of pretty long string baked into the crust , under the cheese and integrated into the sauce. I attached photos. Takes away from the entire experience of eating. Not wanting to figure out what else could be in the pie, I discarded it. It's a shame, I keep trying to give this place a chance, it's been hit/miss but these definitely left a bad taste in my mouth (pun totally intended but also sad because it's accurate).

OLD REVIEW
Ordered 3 items
1 slice of Margherita pizza = pretty small piece maybe 5" x 2.5" what i got instead was white pizza with some pesto on it and a spoonful of sauce .
1 eggplant Parm sub = large in size but seemed like everything was out of the freezer and fried, not crisp or flavorful.
1 appetizer I never heard before called long hot peppers and fried potatoes = this was $10 so keep that in mind. Please see the photo. The photo was taken after I ate 3 fries. So 20% was steak fries, 80% was the long peppers. The ratio seems a bit off, the entire dish seems off, figured it was going to be fried peppers and fries (no description is given , so my fault for assuming) but 4 potato wedges vs all those peppers seems totally off.

I really wanted to like this place, recently moved to the area, was looking for a "go-to". It has a great location,     I didn't understand why it was a ghost town in there. Until after trying their food. Of course it might have just been an off day, so I will go again (everyone deserves a second chance..., false,  a third or fourth chance :P).

I am writing to share my recent experience at your restaurant, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations.

I ordered the rigatoni with Alfredo sauce with grilled chicken , but I found the sauce to be overly oily and lacking in flavor. It was quite disappointing, as I was looking forward to a delicious meal. Additionally, I encountered some issues with the service. The young lady at the register did not seem to provide the level of customer service I would have hoped for. I also noticed that a cook, who appeared to have a physical limitation, was asked to bring my food to the table, which I felt was unnecessary and unkind.

Furthermore, the lack of air conditioning made the dining environment uncomfortable, especially given the high temperatures outside. It felt more like a sauna than a restaurant, which detracted from the overall experience.

I believe that feedback is essential for improvement, and I hope you take this into consideration. Thank you for your attention to these matters.

The food is their own unique thing, not like the standard pizza style of the area.  It's like a really gourmet version of Ellios.  The crispy fried cheese on the edge of the square crust is memorable and different than the soft bread stick that traditionally encircles a NY/NJ slice of pizza, and if you have the open mind for it, it's good.  The sauce wasn't wildly spicy like Pizza Hut or Papa John's but it also wasn't a tangy tart layer of razor thin marinara, like it would be in the regional style.  It was mellow and I detected a saltiness that could have leeched from the chest.  The crust is why I said Ellios. It isn't NY Sicilian style nor Chicago in thickness, but reminds me more of those blowing alley pizzas of the last century.

The staff were very friendly.  The seating is spacious and comfortable.  But - the color scheme is muted, like the penitentiary feel of a 2023 McDonald's.  I would have given more points for friendly red and white checkerboard patterns or even just the lack of the color black.  Trying to appear new and hip shouldn't mean making people's seasonal affective disorder worse.  Buy a can of red or green paint and go nuts, guys.  One more cookie cutter hip black restaurant is like one more pair of white briefs on the pizza arse of America.

Update: I went back to try that chicken.  It came in the form of a Chicken Parmigiana sandwich, which had a nice sauce but fresh mozzarella, which is tasteless when melted.  Indeed, it does have seasoned breading, and all the more interesting that it's seasoned panko bread, which deserves recognition for being seasoned despite being panko.
The staff are friendly and helpful.  The place is clean.  They have a true South Philly Cheese Steak! The pizza has a great tasting crust and fresh toppings

recentReviews.author: Ron ‚ÄúMedicare Ron‚Äù Rivers
recentReviews.text: Very nice decor and the Pizza was good. I was expecting more from what others told me. Its a slice that you have to eat while hot. They use a thin crust without asking. Its fancy pizza and pricy. Cheese Pizza starts at $20. One size. Im sure they'll do well.

recentReviews.author: Luis Perez
recentReviews.text:
I am writing to share my recent experience at your restaurant, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations.

I ordered the rigatoni with Alfredo sauce with grilled chicken , but I found the sauce to be overly oily and lacking in flavor. It was quite disappointing, as I was looking forward to a delicious meal. Additionally, I encountered some issues with the service. The young lady at the register did not seem to provide the level of customer service I would have hoped for. I also noticed that a cook, who appeared to have a physical limitation, was asked to bring my food to the table, which I felt was unnecessary and unkind.

Furthermore, the lack of air conditioning made the dining environment uncomfortable, especially given the high temperatures outside. It felt more like a sauna than a restaurant, which detracted from the overall experience.

I believe that feedback is essential for improvement, and I hope you take this into consideration. Thank you for your attention to these matters.

recentReviews.author: Christine Laraba
recentReviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful.  The place is clean.  They have a true South Philly Cheese Steak! The pizza has a great tasting crust and fresh toppings

recentReviews.author: A U
recentReviews.text:
UPDATE 6/9/2024
I am changing my review to 5 stars. I've ordered 4x in the last 6 weeks and each time the food has been great. The staff has been super friendly(they always were), but the food has been delicious.  I got their Monday special for a large classic pie for $10 and it tastes way better than my encounter (found below) from last January. Glad to see their leadership has taken control and changed the quality of food. Will definitely be coming back , also really happy because they are conveniently located for me. Love to support local business.

UPDATE 1/9/23
Ordered a large pie and there was a piece of pretty long string baked into the crust , under the cheese and integrated into the sauce. I attached photos. Takes away from the entire experience of eating. Not wanting to figure out what else could be in the pie, I discarded it. It's a shame, I keep trying to give this place a chance, it's been hit/miss but these definitely left a bad taste in my mouth (pun totally intended but also sad because it's accurate).

OLD REVIEW
Ordered 3 items
1 slice of Margherita pizza = pretty small piece maybe 5" x 2.5" what i got instead was white pizza with some pesto on it and a spoonful of sauce .
1 eggplant Parm sub = large in size but seemed like everything was out of the freezer and fried, not crisp or flavorful.
1 appetizer I never heard before called long hot peppers and fried potatoes = this was $10 so keep that in mind. Please see the photo. The photo was taken after I ate 3 fries. So 20% was steak fries, 80% was the long peppers. The ratio seems a bit off, the entire dish seems off, figured it was going to be fried peppers and fries (no description is given , so my fault for assuming) but 4 potato wedges vs all those peppers seems totally off.

I really wanted to like this place, recently moved to the area, was looking for a "go-to". It has a great location,     I didn't understand why it was a ghost town in there. Until after trying their food. Of course it might have just been an off day, so I will go again (everyone deserves a second chance..., false,  a third or fourth chance :P).

recentReviews.author: Joseph Kennedy
recentReviews.text:
The food is their own unique thing, not like the standard pizza style of the area.  It's like a really gourmet version of Ellios.  The crispy fried cheese on the edge of the square crust is memorable and different than the soft bread stick that traditionally encircles a NY/NJ slice of pizza, and if you have the open mind for it, it's good.  The sauce wasn't wildly spicy like Pizza Hut or Papa John's but it also wasn't a tangy tart layer of razor thin marinara, like it would be in the regional style.  It was mellow and I detected a saltiness that could have leeched from the chest.  The crust is why I said Ellios. It isn't NY Sicilian style nor Chicago in thickness, but reminds me more of those blowing alley pizzas of the last century.

The staff were very friendly.  The seating is spacious and comfortable.  But - the color scheme is muted, like the penitentiary feel of a 2023 McDonald's.  I would have given more points for friendly red and white checkerboard patterns or even just the lack of the color black.  Trying to appear new and hip shouldn't mean making people's seasonal affective disorder worse.  Buy a can of red or green paint and go nuts, guys.  One more cookie cutter hip black restaurant is like one more pair of white briefs on the pizza arse of America.

Update: I went back to try that chicken.  It came in the form of a Chicken Parmigiana sandwich, which had a nice sauce but fresh mozzarella, which is tasteless when melted.  Indeed, it does have seasoned breading, and all the more interesting that it's seasoned panko bread, which deserves recognition for being seasoned despite being panko.

neutral.text: Very nice decor and the Pizza was good. I was expecting more from what others told me. Its a slice that you have to eat while hot. They use a thin crust without asking. Its fancy pizza and pricy. Cheese Pizza starts at $20. One size. Im sure they'll do well.

negative.author: Luis Perez
negative.text:
I am writing to share my recent experience at your restaurant, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations.

I ordered the rigatoni with Alfredo sauce with grilled chicken , but I found the sauce to be overly oily and lacking in flavor. It was quite disappointing, as I was looking forward to a delicious meal. Additionally, I encountered some issues with the service. The young lady at the register did not seem to provide the level of customer service I would have hoped for. I also noticed that a cook, who appeared to have a physical limitation, was asked to bring my food to the table, which I felt was unnecessary and unkind.

Furthermore, the lack of air conditioning made the dining environment uncomfortable, especially given the high temperatures outside. It felt more like a sauna than a restaurant, which detracted from the overall experience.

I believe that feedback is essential for improvement, and I hope you take this into consideration. Thank you for your attention to these matters.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 3.6/5 rating from 5 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers appreciate the unique, gourmet-style pizza with crispy fried cheese on the edge of the square crust, distinguishing it from the standard pizza style of the area. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant offers a true South Philly Cheese Steak, which is a standout menu item that customers love. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The staff are consistently praised for being super friendly and helpful, enhancing the overall dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Lack of air conditioning and uncomfortable dining environment - social media marketing can improve this area
Negative reviews about food quality and service issues - review management can address this concern
Unappealing color scheme and ambiance - social media marketing can improve this area

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews

recommendations.title: Improve Customer Satisfaction
recommendations.description: Address common issues mentioned in reviews
recommendations.impact: Boost overall rating and customer retention
